tweet: A reverse auction is a type of auction in which the roles of buyers and sellers are reversed.
In an ordinary auction, buyers compete to obtain a good or service, & the price typically increases over time.
In a reverse auction, sellers compete to obtain business, and prices typically decrease over time.
In business, a reverse auction most commonly refers for a specific type of auction process used in business-to-business procurement.
Reverse auctions are also called procurement auction, e-auction, sourcing event, e-sourcing or an eRA.
